_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Grain and Field Bean Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Federated Co-ops, Inc.Executive Summary, anhydrous ammonia



Facility Description

Our facility is a wholesale farm supply distribution center.  We store and distribute a wide variety of Ag

supplies, anhydrous ammonia being one of those products.  Anhydrous ammonia is received by truck

and stored on site.  We refill 1000 and 1500 gallon nurse tanks for area growers they use as a source of nitrogen

for their crops.  This location has an 18,000 gallon storeage tank when filled will hold approximately

80,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.  We also have 28-1000 gallon nurse tanks and 4-1500 gallon

nurse tanks.



Accidental Release Prevention

Federated Co-ops, Inc. has developed a safety Committee involving employees from all locations.  This is to

ensure involvement on all levels.  Federated Co-ops, Inc.'s goal is to have an accident free work environment.

We hold monthly monthly safety training sessions to instill this in our employees.  Before any employee 

works with anhyrous ammonia or any sensitive material they are required to complete safety and handling 

training.  The training consists of classroom lecture, current videos, testing and certification and hands-on

training.  Location managers are directly involved to make sure training is complete.



A documented safety equipment check is required each time a fill is made.  Checks include valves, hoses,

bleeder vales, guages, water supply, gloves and goggles, tires, wheel bearings, relief valves and general

condition of the equipment.  These checks involve a complete check of the equipment being filled including

all safety equipment is in working order.  The Safety Director is responsible for checking these for accuracy.

Any equipment found to be defective is put out of service immediately or corrected on the spot.



Our storeage tank is protected from major releases by internal excess flow valves and hose break-aways.

These measures are in place to stop the flow immediately in the event of hose

or line failure.  All valves

are locked when not in use.  Our facility is inspected on a regular basis to ensure safety.



Worst Case Scenario

Our worst case scenario would involve the total loss of product in the storeage tank.  When filled to capasity

this would amount to 80,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.  Results of the RMP*Comp show that total

release over a 10-minute period would have off-site impacts.  Federated Co-ops, Inc. has never had any kind 

of release at any of its storeage facilities and hope this record continues.



Alternative Release Scenario

The most common alternative release scenario from our facility would not reach an end point off-site.

The alternative release using RMP*Comp with a 5 minute release at 1000 pounds per minute would have some

off-site impact.  Again Federated has never had a release at any storeage facility.



Five year History

There have never been any accidents at any of our sites causing death, injury or property damage.



Emergency Response Program

In the event of an emergency involving our ammonia system, it is Federated's policy to notify the local fire department and request that they respond to the emergency.  In preperation for this, we have coordinated with all the local response agencies by providing information and tours if needed to ensure that they are familiar with our facility.  This will help to

ensure that our community has a strategy for responding to the threat posed by an ammonia release.
